trans-unit.source: Retrieves the date and time that a file was created, accessed and modified

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves the date and time that a file was created, accessed and modified

target.mrk: Retrieves the date and time that a file was created, accessed and modified

trans-unit.source: Handle to the file for which dates and times are to be retrieved. The file handle must have been created using the CreateFile function with the GENERIC_READ access right.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the file for which dates and times are to be retrieved.
The file handle must have been created using the CreateFile function with the GENERIC_READ access right.

target.mrk: Handle to the file for which dates and times are to be retrieved.
The file handle must have been created using the CreateFile function with the GENERIC_READ access right.

trans-unit.source: Returns an array with the following format:

seg-source.mrk: Returns an array with the following format:

target.mrk: Returns an array with the following format:

trans-unit.source: [0] - $tagFILETIME structure with the date and time the file was created

seg-source.mrk: [0] - $tagFILETIME structure with the date and time the file was created

target.mrk: [0] - $tagFILETIME structure with the date and time the file was created

trans-unit.source: [1] - $tagFILETIME structure with the date and time the file was accessed

seg-source.mrk: [1] - $tagFILETIME structure with the date and time the file was accessed

target.mrk: [1] - $tagFILETIME structure with the date and time the file was accessed

trans-unit.source: [2] - $tagFILETIME structure with the date and time the file was modified

seg-source.mrk: [2] - $tagFILETIME structure with the date and time the file was modified

target.mrk: [2] - $tagFILETIME structure with the date and time the file was modified

trans-unit.source: Not all file systems can record creation and last access times and not all file systems record them in the same manner.

seg-source.mrk: Not all file systems can record creation and last access times and not all file systems record them in the same manner.

target.mrk: Not all file systems can record creation and last access times and not all file systems record them in the same manner.

trans-unit.source: For example, on FAT, create time has a resolution of 10 milliseconds, write time has a resolution of 2 seconds, and access time has a resolution of 1 day (really, the access date). Therefore, the _Date_Time_GetFileTime() function may not return the same file time information set using _Date_Time_SetFileTime().

seg-source.mrk: For example, on FAT, create time has a resolution of 10 milliseconds, write time has a resolution of 2 seconds, and access time has a resolution of 1 day (really, the access date).
Therefore, the _Date_Time_GetFileTime() function may not return the same file time information set using _Date_Time_SetFileTime().

target.mrk: For example, on FAT, create time has a resolution of 10 milliseconds, write time has a resolution of 2 seconds, and access time has a resolution of 1 day (really, the access date).
Therefore, the _Date_Time_GetFileTime() function may not return the same file time information set using _Date_Time_SetFileTime().

trans-unit.source: NTFS delays updates to the last access time for a file by up to one hour after the last access.

seg-source.mrk: NTFS delays updates to the last access time for a file by up to one hour after the last access.

target.mrk: NTFS delays updates to the last access time for a file by up to one hour after the last access.
